Let’sKNOW Let’sKNOWSafety FirstUnit–III : Our Values
11
Acciden ts can happen at any place and at any time. They mos tly happen due 
to our carelessness. At times, they can cause serious injuries.
We need to be aware and responsible for 
our own safety. We need  to follow some 
safety rules so that accidents can be 
avoided.Look at the given pictur e. All these are examples of acciden ts.
! Have you e ver fallen and hurt y ourself?
! Have you e ver by mis take cut y our fing er with a blade or knif e?
Safety on R oads
Majority of the acciden ts occur on roads. We need to be very cautious and follow 
the basic traffic rules.
! Do not run or play on the streets.
! Always cross the road at zebra crossing.
! Walk on a footpa th.Starter
Environmental Studies-4 82

! Do not jump on benches and tables.
! Do not push each other .
! Do not run up or down the stairs.
! Do not run in the corridor s.
! Never fight with your schoolma tes.
! If, you get hurt, inform your teacher or any other elder person. They will give you 
first aid.! Wear a seat belt while travelling in a car.
! Follow the traffic signals and obey the traffic rules.
Safety in School
Safety at Home
! Do not play with needles, blades, knives or any other sharp objects.
! Do not play with match sticks, near burning stoves or fire.
! Do not touch electric wires or poin ts with wet hands. You may get an electric 
shock.
! Do not fly kites on an open terrace.
! Do not lean out over a railing.
! Do not scatter your toys or other articles on the floor . You could trip over them.
Environmental Studies-483

You  Know Must (Knowledge )Safety protocols in Emergency Situation
We need to follow some safety tips in emer gency situa tions such as fire, floods, 
earthquak e, landslides etc.
Safety protocol for fire
! Switch off the gas regula tor when not in use.
! Install smok e alarms at your homes/ offices.
! Keep your heating instrumen ts in check.
! Learn to use a fire extinguisher .
! In case of intense fire, inform fire station.
The emer gency number of a fir e station is 101.
Safety protocol for floods
 Overflo w of water on land is called flood. It may happen due to heavy rains or 
any other natural disas ter.
 In case of floods–
! Move immedia tely to higher ground area.
! Follow instructions from public safety officials.
! Never drive or walk through flood-w ater.
! Follow evacua tion orders.
! Continue to check media for emer gency informa tions.Emergency
An emer gency is serious event that needs immedia te action. e.g. fire, floods, 
earthquak es, landslides etc.
Environmental Studies-4 84

Safety protocol for earthquak es
Sudden shaking of earth's surface is called earthquak e.
 During earthquak e–
! Move away from buildings, electric wires and gas lines.
! Go to an open area away from trees, poles and buildings.
! Do not use the elevators/ lifts. The electricity may go out.
! If you are inside the home, drop down onto your hands and knees to protect 
yourself from falling.
! Cover your head and neck (and entire body if possible) undernea th a sturdy 
table or a bed.
! Hold on to your shelt er until the shaking stops.
Protocol For Landslides
The rapid downslope movemen t of earth materials like rocks, debris and soil, is 
called landslide. 
 During a landslide–
! Stay calm and alert.
! Follow evacua tion orders and instruction from the local authorities.
! Move to higher grounds.
! Stay away from steep slopes or hill sides.
! Curl into a ball and protect your head if escape is not possible.
! Assemble an emer gency kit having pack aged food, water, first-aid material, flash 
light, blank ets etc. Keep the kit in a readily accessible place.
! Determine safe areas on your property or nearb y to seek shelt er in a landslide.
Emergency Services
Emer gency services are  organisa tions that ensur e public safety, security and 
health during emer gencies.
Fire station– During emergency situations, apart from fire fighting, the 
departmen t also undert akes rescue oper ations and saves people trapped in debris 
of fallen buildings, caugh t in floods or land slides.
Environmental Studies-485

You  Know Must (Knowledge )
You  Know Must (Knowledge )Hospit als– During emer gency situa tions–
! Hospit als take necessar y actions to control crowd and traffic within the hospit al. 
They main tain a register for victims of disas ter.
! Provide necessar y instructions to patients & their relatives.
! Qualified emer gency doct ors and nurses provide emer gent care to save lines of 
victims.
The emer gency n umber f or Ambulanc e servic e is 102.
Police stations– The primar y role of police during disas ters is Sear ch and Rescue 
(SAR) which includes–
! To iden tify and assis t those who are in need of help.
! To supply relief materials like food and water to the people trapped in disas ter.
! To arrange for proper medic al treatmen t to the injur ed individuals.
! To stop people from taking advantage of the situa tion.
The emer gency n umber f or P olice Station is 100.
Ethical Use of Media
During emer gency , media plays an import ant role. Some of the poin ts are–
! Quickly sends out alerts.
! Shar es upda tes and safety tips.
! Provides rapid feedback from the witnesses of the event.
! Transmit reques ts for help.
Environmental Studies-4 86

Wrap-  U p Wrap-  U pKey Poin ts of the Chap ter! Protocol  – Necessar y steps that mus t be taken in a particular 
situa tion.
! Fire-extinguisher – A metal container with chemic als inside that is 
used for stopping small fires. 
! Evacua tion – The act of moving people from a dang erous place 
to some wher e safe. 
! Sturdy  – Not easily breakable; strong .
! Accessible – Reachable, easy to get.
! Rescue  – To save
! Debris  – Pieces of some thing that has been destroyed.
! Victim  – A person who has been harmed.
Ÿ Acciden ts mos tly happen due to our carelessness.
Ÿ To avoid acciden ts, we should follow safety rules.
Ÿ Emer gency means any serious event that needs immedia te action.
Ÿ We should follow safety protocols in emer gencies.
Ÿ Emer gency services are organisa tions that ensur e public safety and health 
during emer gencies.

Let’sKNOW Let’sKNOWIndia : A L and of 
Rich CultureUnit–III : Our Values
12
Starter
India is a land of rich cultur e and herit age. People in different states speak 
different languag es, eat different foods and celebr ate different festivals. The 
diverse languag es, customs, dresses, music, dances and religious belie fs are 
part of the Indian Cultur e and mak e India a unique country.! Write the names of these f estivals in the giv en spaces.
! Which s tate of India does each of these f estivals belong t o?
Languages
Different languag es are spok en in different parts of our country. Hindi is the official 
languag e of the country. Ther e are 22 languag es recogniz ed by the constitution of 
India which are used as the official languag e at the state level. These are—
1. Assamese, 2.Bangla, 3. Bodo , 4, Dogri, 5. Gujar ati, 6. Hindi, 7. Kannada, 8. 
Kashmiri, 9. Konkani, 10. Maithili, 11. Maly alam, 12. Manipuri, 13. Marathi, 14.  Look at the given pictures.
1. __________ 4. __________ 3. __________ 2. __________
Environmental Studies-491

Nepali, 15, Odia, 16. Punjabi, 17. Sanskrit, 18. Santhali, 19. Sindhi, 20. Tamil, 21. 
Telugu, 22. Urdu.
Dresses
The regional diversity of India is found in the dresses worn by the people of 
different regions. The traditional costumes of men and women are different in 
mos t of the states.
Though saree is the mos t popular dress worn by the women of India, it is worn in 
different styles in different regions. The other popular dress worn by the women of 
northern India is Salw ar Kamee z.
The ghagr a-choli is worn by the women in Rajas than. The traditional dress worn by 
women in Haryana is Daman kurti and Chadder .
The tr aditional dr ess of men in India ar e dhoti-k urta, kurta-pyjama or lungi and a 
turban or cap.
These days men and women also wear trouser s, shirts, jeans and T-shirts.Sanskrit and T amil ar e two o f the old est langu ages o f the world.
Food
Just as people in different parts of India speak different languag es, they also enjo y 
eating different types of cuisines.
Rajma-cha wal, chhole-bha ture and shahi paneer are popular in North India. Fish 
curry and rice are eaten in eastern states (Bihar , West Beng al, Odisha etc etc.)
Dal-ba ti-churma is enjo yed by the people in 
Rajasthan. Gujarat is famous for dhokla, 
thepla and khandvi while sambar -idli and 
dosa are popular in south India.
Gener ally, the staple food of people of a state 
is wha t grows in that region. Whea t, rice and 
mille ts are the main staple food of Indians. 
Different types of vegetables and You  Know Must (Knowledge )
Environmental Studies-4 92

dals are prepar ed in different ways in different parts of the country. The choice of 
cooking oil also varies region to region. Groundnut oil is used in Northern India, 
coconut oil is used in Southern India  and mus tard oil is used in Eastern India.
A variety of spices are grown in India. 
They add flavour and colour to the food.
Dances and Music
In our cultur e, dance and music are used for recreation as well to express devotion 
to God. Indian dance and music can be classified into classic al and folk.
The major classic al dances and their states of origin are–
 1. Bhar atnatyam – Tamil Nadu 
 2. Kathak  – Uttar Pradesh
 3. Kuchipudi  – Andhr a Pradesh
 4. Manipuri  – Manipur
 5. Odissi  – Odisha
 6. Sattriya  – Assam
 7. Kathak ali  – Kerala 
 8. Mohinia ttam – KeralaDance
Some of the popular folk dances are–
 1. Bhangr a and gidda – Punjab
 2. Ghoomar  – Rajas than
 3. Dandia and garba – Gujar at
 4. Lavani  – Mahar ashtra
 5. Bihu   – Assam
 6. Phag and Dhamaal – Haryana
 7. Nati   – Himachal Pradesh
 8. Chholiy a  – Uttarakhand
Environmental Studies-493

Wrap-  U p Wrap-  U pKey Poin ts of the Chap terKey termsKey termsKey termsYou  Know Must (Knowledge )Music has always been a part of Indian cultur e. Indian classic al music is divided into 
two styles.
 1. Hindus tani Music  2. Carna tic Music
Hindus tani Music developed in the northern part of India while carna tic music 
developed in the southern part.
Both the styles of music are based on a combina tion of raga and tala. Each raga is 
sung at a particular time according to the specific season and occasion, while tala is 
the beat of music.
Hindut ani music comprises of thumri, tappa, ghaz al, khayal and dhrupada styles. 
The famous singers of Hindus tani music  were Tansen, Haridas and Baiju Bawra.
Carna tic music gives import ance to bhak ti and devotion.Music
Tansen was one of the nine gems in Akbar's court. He composed and sang 
man y ragas like raga Deepak, which could light diyas and raga Megh-
Malhar , which could bring rain.
! Unique  – Being the only one of its type.
! Constitution – Set of basic laws and rules of a country.
! Cuisines – Type of food cooked in a specific way based on 
region and culture.
Ÿ India is a unique and diverse country with a rich cultur e and herit age.
Ÿ The constitution of India recognises 22 languag es.
Ÿ Different states have their own traditional costumes for men and women.
Ÿ Different types of food items are eaten by Indians depending on the 
availability in their region.
Ÿ Dance and music enrich the cultur e of India.
Environmental Studies-4 94

Let’sKNOW Let’sKNOWStarterWe Need Each-OtherUnit–IV : Our Values
13
Man is a social animal who c an not liv e alone. Righ t from ancien t times, he 
has lived in groups and communities. Community member s cooper ate with 
each other and shar e work and duties. When we look around, we find man y 
people who help us in our daily lives. They mak e our lives comfortable and 
easy.! Who gr ows food f or you? ___________
! Who tr eats you when y ou ar e sick? ___________
! Who mak es furnitur e for your houses? ___________
Different Kinds of W ork
People do different kinds of jobs to earn mone y. Any job that a person does to earn 
mone y is called an occupa tion or profession.
Skilled and Unskilled Work–  A skill is the ability to do a task well. Some jobs do not 
need any training by experts. These jobs are called unskilled work. They are 
learned through observation and practice. Man y jobs requir e  special training 
Environmental Studies-4 98

which is impart ed by expert faculties at colleg es and institut es. Studen ts receiv e 
degr ees and diplomas after success ful comple tion of their training. 
Let us know about some people who help us to live a comfortable life.
Farmer
Dayaram is farmer . His occupa tion is farming. He 
grow different types of food grains, vegetables and 
fruits. He ploughs the field, sows the seeds and 
harvests the crop. By selling his crop in the mark et, 
he help s us to get our food and at the same time, 
earns mone y for his family . He learn t this work from 
his father and grandf ather.
Carpenter
Rajesh is a carpenter. He makes wooden 
furnitur e and door s, windo ws and other fitting 
for buildings. We all need these things. He learn t 
this work from his father. 
Tailor
Prem is a tailor . He stitches beautiful dresses 
using a sewing machine. He learn t this work from 
his father.
Washerman
Ramu is a washerman. He washes our clothes 
and irons them. He learn t this work with regular 
practice.
Environmental Studies-499

Potter
Balde v is a potter. He mak es beautiful earthen 
pots on potter's wheel. His wife makes 
beautiful designs on these pots. His 
grandf ather taugh t him this beautiful craft.
Weaver
Rafiq is a weaver. He weaves clothes on a loom. 
He learn t this work from his uncle.
Embroiderer
Sonali is an embr oider er. She mak es attractiv e 
designs on ladies suits and sarees  with a needle 
and thread. She learn t this art from her mother .
Doctor
Dr. Rakesh Singh is a doctor. He treats sick 
people. He got his training and a degr ee from a 
medic al colleg e.
Engineer
Mr. Sachin Dube y is an engineer . He got his training 
and a degr ee from an engineering colleg e. He mak e 
blueprin ts for building , bridg es, roads, houses etc.
Environmental Studies-4 100

You  Know Must (Knowledge )
NGOs are volun tary organisations run by a group of people with social 
causes.Pilot
Mr. Anupam Sinha is a pilot. He got a formal 
training at a flying institut e.
Factory W orkers
Man y people in cities work in different factories. 
They mos tly work with machines that they have 
been trained to handle. They work in indus tries like 
textile mills, steel plan ts, sugar mills, plastic goods 
factories etc.
Voluntary W ork
Some jobs are volun tary. People in such jobs do not always earn mone y but work to 
help other s. The duties carried out by the people working in NGOs are examples of 
such jobs.
Gender Equality in Jobs
Earlier , only men worked to earn mone y while women look ed after the house and 
childr en. But, the things have chang ed now. Women too work as teacher s, doct ors, 
nurses, pilots, soldier s, astronauts etc. It is good to see women and men being 
treated equal in the job space.
Environmental Studies-4101

! Skill  – Ability to do some thing well.
! Job  – Work
! Volun tary work – A work without getting paid for it.
